programme.desc: A rebellious teen (Kenny Wormald) incurs the wrath of a much-loved clergyman (Dennis Quaid) by challenging the town's ban on loud music and dancing.

programme.title: Morris From America
programme.desc: A 13-year-old rapper focused on hip-hop stardom falls for a rebellious classmate (Lina Keller) after moving from the U.S. to Germany with his widowed father (Craig Robinson).

programme.title: Big Sur
programme.desc: Jack Duluoz takes three trips to poet Lawrence Ferlinghetti's cabin in Big Sur.

programme.title: Proof
programme.desc: A depressed woman (Gwyneth Paltrow) copes with the death of her father (Anthony Hopkins), a brilliant but mentally ill mathematician.

programme.title: Gloria Bell
programme.desc: A free-spirited divorcee spends her nights on the dance floor, joyfully letting loose at clubs around Los Angeles. She soon finds herself thrust into an unexpected new romance, filled with the joys of budding love and the complications of dating.

programme.title: Monday
programme.desc: When Mickey is introduced to Chloe one hot summer night in Athens, the attraction between the pair is immediately palpable -- so palpable that before they know it they're waking up naked on the beach on Saturday morning.

programme.title: The Canyons
programme.desc: The discovery of an illicit love affair leads two young Angelenos on a violent, sexually charged tour through the dark side of human nature.

programme.title: Fresh
programme.desc: Death and violence anger a 12-year-old drug courier (Sean Nelson) who pits his employers against each other.

programme.title: Morris From America
programme.desc: A 13-year-old rapper focused on hip-hop stardom falls for a rebellious classmate (Lina Keller) after moving from the U.S. to Germany with his widowed father (Craig Robinson).

programme.title: Andy & the Donald
programme.desc: Donald Trump is holding cheerleading auditions for his new football team, and Andy Warhol sees it as the perfect opportunity to settle an old debt.

programme.title: The Andromeda Strain
programme.desc: Scientists (Arthur Hill, David Wayne, James Olson) rush to isolate an alien germ brought back by a space probe.

programme.title: Reds
programme.desc: U.S. journalist John Reed (Warren Beatty) and wife Louise Bryant (Diane Keaton) witness the Russian Revolution.

programme.title: Mine 9
programme.desc: Miners struggle to survive after an explosion leaves them trapped two miles underground.

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: A literature professor (Mark Wahlberg) with gambling debts borrows money from a mobster and offers his life as collateral while immersing himself in an illicit, underground world.

programme.title: Shutter Island
programme.desc: A 1950s lawman (Leonardo DiCaprio) pursues a murderess who appears to have vanished from a locked room within a fortresslike psychiatric hospital.

programme.title: Happy, Texas
programme.desc: Townspeople mistake two escaped convicts (Jeremy Northam, Steve Zahn) for a gay couple staging a girls beauty pageant.

programme.title: American Honey
programme.desc: A portrait of this generation's youth living on the edge, the film follows Star (Sasha Lane), a free-spirited, teenage rebel who hits the road with a group of hard-partying, fellow misfits and discovers adventure, hope and first love.

programme.title: Zola
programme.desc: Zola, a Detroit waitress, is seduced into a weekend of stripping in Florida for some quick cash -- but the trip becomes a sleepless 48-hour odyssey involving a nefarious friend, her pimp and her idiot boyfriend.

programme.title: Ice Girls
programme.desc: A 15-year-old figure skating champion leaves the sport after her mother loses her job and the family moves to a small town. She struggles to fit in until the owner of a local skating arena helps her fulfill her true potential.

programme.title: Big Top Pee-wee
programme.desc: Childlike Pee-wee Herman (Paul Reubens) falls for a circus star (Valeria Golino) whose troupe is stranded on his strange farm.

programme.title: Saving Flora
programme.desc: After learning that an aging circus elephant is scheduled to be euthanized, the circus owner's daughter decides to kidnap her and relocate her to an elephant preserve.

programme.title: The War With Grandpa
programme.desc: Forced to give up his room to his grandfather, a scheming boy devises a series of outrageous pranks in an attempt to make him move out.

programme.title: Mirror Mirror
programme.desc: Saved from death by a band of diminutive highway robbers, an exiled princess (Lily Collins) vows to win back her kingdom from an evil queen (Julia Roberts).

programme.title: The Man in the Iron Mask
programme.desc: Musketeers (Jeremy Irons, John Malkovich) try to displace corrupt King Louis XIV (Leonardo DiCaprio) with his twin brother, imprisoned in the Bastille.

programme.title: Aeon Flux
programme.desc: In the last city on Earth, underground rebels dispatch their top assassin (Charlize Theron) to kill a government leader.

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: A slain Manhattan yuppie (Patrick Swayze) reaches out to his lover (Demi Moore), with a medium (Whoopi Goldberg) as his middlewoman.

programme.title: Dean Smith
programme.desc: The life of the college basketball coach who retired with the most wins in college basketball history.

programme.title: The Fits
programme.desc: An 11-year-old tomboy (Royalty Hightower) tries to fit in with her peers after joining an all-girl dance team.

programme.title: Against the Tide
programme.desc: A chronicle of the 1970 college football match-up between USC and the Crimson Tide examines the surprising decision made by legendary coach Paul Bear Bryant and its lasting impact on the struggle for integration.

programme.title: Love Story
programme.desc: An old-money Harvard man Oliver (Ryan O'Neal) woos and weds a no-money music student (Ali MacGraw) from the wrong side of the tracks.

programme.title: Labyrinth
programme.desc: Teenage Sarah (Jennifer Connelly) journeys through a maze to recover her baby brother (Toby Froud) from a goblin king (David Bowie).

programme.title: Searching for Bobby Fischer
programme.desc: A boy (Max Pomeranc) and his parents (Joe Mantegna, Joan Allen) must decide what to do about his newly discovered aptitude for world-class chess.

programme.title: Spy Kids
programme.desc: When a technical genius kidnaps retired spies (Antonio Banderas, Carla Gugino), only their children can save them.

programme.title: Troop Beverly Hills
programme.desc: An idle rich woman's (Shelley Long) husband (Craig T. Nelson) challenges her to lead their daughter's troop of campers.

programme.title: The Wiz
programme.desc: Dorothy (Diana Ross) eases on down the road to see the Wiz (Richard Pryor) with Tinman, Scarecrow (Michael Jackson) and Cowardly Lion.

programme.title: Daddy Day Camp
programme.desc: Chaos reigns when two clueless fathers (Cuba Gooding Jr., Paul Rae) take charge of a dilapidated summer camp and its ill-behaved attendees.

programme.title: The Longest Yard
programme.desc: At a Texas penitentiary, jailed NFL veterans (Adam Sandler, Burt Reynolds) train their fellow inmates for a football game against the guards.

programme.title: Seabiscuit
programme.desc: A jockey (Tobey Maguire), an automobile magnate (Jeff Bridges) and a trainer (Chris Cooper) lead a racehorse to glory during the Great Depression.

programme.title: Senior Moment
programme.desc: After drag racing his vintage convertible around Palm Springs, Calif., a retired NASA test pilot loses his license. Forced to take public transportation, he meets Caroline and learns to navigate love and life again.

programme.title: Empire Records
programme.desc: A frustrated record-store manager (Anthony LaPaglia) dreams of owning the business, then an employee (Rory Cochrane) gambles away his down payment.

programme.title: Boys and Girls
programme.desc: Two longtime friends (Freddie Prinze Jr., Claire Forlani), each with a string of failed romances, wonder if they should date each other.

programme.title: Spy Kids
programme.desc: When a technical genius kidnaps retired spies (Antonio Banderas, Carla Gugino), only their children can save them.

programme.title: A Little Game
programme.desc: Ostracized at her new school and grief-stricken over her grandmother's death, a 10-year-old girl (Makenna Ballard) learns about persevering in the face of inevitable change from an irascible chessmaster (F. Murray Abraham).

programme.title: The Curse of the Jade Scorpion
programme.desc: After making an insurance investigator (Woody Allen) fall for an efficiency expert, a hypnotist forces the guy to steal jewels.

programme.title: Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
programme.desc: A young sister (Alexa Vega) and brother encounter mutants and a wild scientist while searching for a device that could destroy Earth.

programme.title: Spy Kids 3-D: Game Over
programme.desc: A boy tries to rescue his sister (Alexa Vega) inside a virtual-reality game created by a madman out to enslave children.

programme.title: The Farewell
programme.desc: Billi's family returns to China under the guise of a fake wedding to stealthily say goodbye to their beloved matriarch -- the only person that doesn't know she only has a few weeks to live.

programme.title: Queen Bees
programme.desc: While her house undergoes repairs, fiercely independent senior Helen temporarily moves into a nearby retirement community, where she encounters lusty widows, cutthroat bridge tournaments and a hotbed of bullying ``mean girls.``.

programme.title: Mirror Mirror
programme.desc: Saved from death by a band of diminutive highway robbers, an exiled princess (Lily Collins) vows to win back her kingdom from an evil queen (Julia Roberts).

programme.title: A Royal Night Out
programme.desc: As Europe celebrates V-E Day in 1945, teenage princesses Elizabeth (Sarah Gadon) and Margaret (Bel Powley) spend a wild evening in London.

programme.title: Kinky Boots
programme.desc: A fortuitous encounter with a transvestite cabaret singer (Chiwetel Ejiofor) inspires a young man (Joel Edgerton) to save an inherited shoe factory by producing erotic footwear.

programme.title: Dirty Dancing: Havana Nights
programme.desc: Love blossoms between a young Cuban (Diego Luna) and an American teenager (Romola Garai) as they prepare for a New Year's Eve dance contest.

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season's fury.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Beni and Lala get an unexpected visit from Vet Arga, Kesi makes a new friend on Bangamat Island, and Alejandra deals with a new view of the world after the accident at forest school leaves her blind in one eye.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: The race is on to find Tulia and Zalipa, who are missing from Palas Island. And after months of convalescence, Beni returns to forest school but faces another setback at the milk bucket. Meanwhile, the vets keep a close eye on pregnant Dilla.

programme.title: The Accidental Wilderness: Europe's Everglades
programme.desc: Marvel at the stunning conversion of a bleak waste-water dumping ground into a paradise for Europe's birds. Travel to western Germany for an intimate look at this reclamation success story, and see the thriving animal communities that live there.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Year
programme.desc: Be an eyewitness to the death and resurrection that winter brings to Africa. Observe what comes with shorter days, from drought conditions to frigid winds, and marvel at the survival skills of animals and plants as they face the season's fury.

programme.title: Stormborn
programme.desc: Welcome autumn to the north Atlantic, when its animals struggle to prepare for winter. Trace the grey seals' mating frenzy and witness the horrific price one seal pup must pay. Then see reindeer undertake a perilous swim along their migration path.

programme.title: A Bee's Diary
programme.desc: In a beehive, tens of thousands of tiny animals work toward a common goal: the survival of the colony. But what is life like for an individual honeybee? A Bee's Diary tells that story.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Follow the medical and rehab teams at Toronto Wildlife Centre as they work to clear a rescued fox of mange and return it to the wild. Elsewhere in the centre, meet scores of injured songbirds that have hit downtown buildings on their way south.

programme.title: Great Blue Wild
programme.desc: The Pacific coast of Costa Rica is a biodiversity hotspot that hosts nearly 5,000 species of marine life. But here in this undersea jungle, the ocean's top predator is at risk. Discover how marine defenders are teaming up to save the shark.

programme.title: Rooted
programme.desc: The hardy Namaqua Rock Fig grips a rocky South African slope. Learn how this tree is able to endure rising temperatures and less rainfall each year by sending aggressive roots into the earth for water. This survivor is an oasis for birds and insects.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Follow along as the wildlife rehab team works to treat a baby raccoon, separated from his family, and get him back in the wild before his parents move on. In another part of the centre, watch as an orphaned killdeer is introduced to...himself?

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Beni and Lala get an unexpected visit from Vet Arga, Kesi makes a new friend on Bangamat Island, and Alejandra deals with a new view of the world after the accident at forest school leaves her blind in one eye.

programme.title: A Bee's Diary
programme.desc: In a beehive, tens of thousands of tiny animals work toward a common goal: the survival of the colony. But what is life like for an individual honeybee? A Bee's Diary tells that story.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join the rescue team as they respond to a call about an opossum stuck in a fence that turns out not to be the kind of animal that plays dead. Inside the centre, a goose with a serious foot injury receives physiotherapy before returning to the wild.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Follow an injured opossum into surgery, as the medical team realizes amputation may be the only way to save his badly injured toe. And meet some turtle hatchlings who seem ready for release when the team gets disappointing details about their size.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: It's summer in the Gulf of Oman. The scorching Arabian sun heats the shallow waters to 86 degrees boosting the growth of algae across a vast coral reef. This attracts thousands of hungry herbivores creating a fish versus fish turf war.

programme.title: Arabian Seas
programme.desc: The sea turtle is one of the oldest animals on earth. These ancient mariners even pre-date the dinosaurs. They have existed, relatively unchanged, for over 100 million years. But now, all seven of the surviving species are endangered.

programme.title: Weird, Wild & Wonderful
programme.desc: Trek across Africa for a peek at the colourful, quirky survival strategies of its animals. See these furry, feathered, and scaled magicians, from flamboyant flamingos to vanishing lizards, find food, elude predators, and find mates against all odds.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Tag along as Dr. Amanda rescues a blind pet baboon, and watch Dr. Charlotte's tricky surgery on a pangolin whose leg must be amputated after a run-in with poachers. Later, chase a treed rhino, two young baboons gone AWOL, and a fiesty monitor lizard.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Face a tough decision when Esti's leg infection puts the brakes on this young duiker's release. Then track and collar a young lion with Dr. Amanda; check on an ailing bush baby; and greet the noisy new addition to the centre, a grumpy grey parrot.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Crush a busy day with the team as they release rehabbed pythons, teach a pangolin how to hunt, and round up a troop of vervet monkeys. Search for a missing bird of prey with Dr. Charlotte, while Dr. Amanda helps a bushpig savaged by poachers' dogs.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Tackle an emergency when Dr. Amanda removes a sable antelope's tracking collar, and see the animal-care team help a flea-riddled baby vervet monkey find a new mom. Free two orphaned serval cats and follow 20 yellow baboons into their new enclosure.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Feel heartbreak when Dr. Amanda's team loses a pangolin abused by wildlife traffickers, but cheer when another is released post-rehab. Check on a trio of hedgehogs and tag along as the centre's baboons and nyala antelopes get a change of scenery.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Koala
programme.desc: Despite being one of Australia's best-known marsupials, koalas live only in the east and southeast parts of the continent. Learn how their lives and behaviours vary in these different regions.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Koala
programme.desc: Koalas may seem solitary and inert, but mating season brings a dramatic shift in their behaviour, leading to movement, contact, and conflict. As breeding season begins, follow two large males on a mission to mate.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join the rescue team as they respond to a call about an opossum stuck in a fence that turns out not to be the kind of animal that plays dead. Inside the centre, a goose with a serious foot injury receives physiotherapy before returning to the wild.

programme.desc: Tackle an emergency when Dr. Amanda removes a sable antelope's tracking collar, and see the animal-care team help a flea-riddled baby vervet monkey find a new mom. Free two orphaned serval cats and follow 20 yellow baboons into their new enclosure.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Feel heartbreak when Dr. Amanda's team loses a pangolin abused by wildlife traffickers, but cheer when another is released post-rehab. Check on a trio of hedgehogs and tag along as the centre's baboons and nyala antelopes get a change of scenery.

programme.title: Alaskan Summer
programme.desc: Discover the majesty of the US's most northern state. Shot in stunning HDR, travel from the breathtaking coves and bays of Baranof Island, to the Glacier Bay where humpback and killer whales navigate among towering glaciers and soaring mountains.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Face a tough decision when Esti's leg infection puts the brakes on this young duiker's release. Then track and collar a young lion with Dr. Amanda; check on an ailing bush baby; and greet the noisy new addition to the centre, a grumpy grey parrot.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Koala
programme.desc: Despite being one of Australia's best-known marsupials, koalas live only in the east and southeast parts of the continent. Learn how their lives and behaviours vary in these different regions.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Koala
programme.desc: Koalas may seem solitary and inert, but mating season brings a dramatic shift in their behaviour, leading to movement, contact, and conflict. As breeding season begins, follow two large males on a mission to mate.

programme.title: Secret Life Of The Tasmanian Devil
programme.desc: For Tasmanian devils, dominance is the name of the game during mating season. Meet males who fight for the right to pass on their genes, and learn about the violent, noisy etiquette of these carnivorous marsupials' mealtime.

programme.title: Secret Life Of The Tasmanian Devil
programme.desc: Tasmanian Devils might have the most infamous reputations of any of the country's marsupials, but these spirited scrappers also have another side. They're committed parents and heroic defenders of their pouch-reared young.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Follow an injured opossum into surgery, as the medical team realizes amputation may be the only way to save his badly injured toe. And meet some turtle hatchlings who seem ready for release when the team gets disappointing details about their size.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Face a tough decision when Esti's leg infection puts the brakes on this young duiker's release. Then track and collar a young lion with Dr. Amanda; check on an ailing bush baby; and greet the noisy new addition to the centre, a grumpy grey parrot.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Crush a busy day with the team as they release rehabbed pythons, teach a pangolin how to hunt, and round up a troop of vervet monkeys. Search for a missing bird of prey with Dr. Charlotte, while Dr. Amanda helps a bushpig savaged by poachers' dogs.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Tackle an emergency when Dr. Amanda removes a sable antelope's tracking collar, and see the animal-care team help a flea-riddled baby vervet monkey find a new mom. Free two orphaned serval cats and follow 20 yellow baboons into their new enclosure.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Feel heartbreak when Dr. Amanda's team loses a pangolin abused by wildlife traffickers, but cheer when another is released post-rehab. Check on a trio of hedgehogs and tag along as the centre's baboons and nyala antelopes get a change of scenery.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Koala
programme.desc: Despite being one of Australia's best-known marsupials, koalas live only in the east and southeast parts of the continent. Learn how their lives and behaviours vary in these different regions.

programme.title: Secret Life of the Koala
programme.desc: Koalas may seem solitary and inert, but mating season brings a dramatic shift in their behaviour, leading to movement, contact, and conflict. As breeding season begins, follow two large males on a mission to mate.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Meet a flock of cedar waxwings who have taken over the centre's aviary and are keeping the staff busy with endless demands for food. Then the rescue team works with the Ministry of Natural Resources to relocate a coyote that's too people-friendly.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join the rescue team for a madcap chase after a red-tailed hawk. He may be unable to fly, but he sure can run! Then follow the recovery of a rare albino squirrel who can't walk, and see how the medical team ensures he'll be ready for the wild again.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Join Tom and his team as they travel to some of the most remote and rarely visited volcanoes in Indonesia. Climb to the top of active volcanoes that are in a constant state of eruption, and see just how explosive these giant craters can be.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Tom explores how volcanoes have influenced Mexico's people and history. See how volcanic eruptions have destroyed ancient cultures-and how their unique landscapes have given rise to one of the world's most famous alcoholic beverages.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Join Tom on a dangerous adventure to two of the most active volcanoes in Indonesia, where he's greeted with otherworldly landscapes filled with toxic gases, fire, and brimstone that inspired mythological visions of hell.

programme.title: Deadly Australians
programme.desc: Deep in the Australian forests, lethal predators lie in wait to ambush their prey. Here, Amethystine Pythons lurk high up in the canopy, Tiger Quolls troll the forest floor, and deadly scorpions dwell in the shadows of the undergrowth.

programme.title: Deadly Australians
programme.desc: The waters originating from highland streams flow through varied terrain before emptying into the sea. Along the way, an assortment of environmental niches set the stage for fierce battles between predators and prey.

programme.title: Deadly Australians
programme.desc: A motley crew of killers, con artists, and gang members fight for supremacy amidst the dry and desolate Australian desert. Here, heat and dehydration kill indiscriminately and competition for resources is brutal. Only the toughest survive.

programme.title: Deadly Australians
programme.desc: The Australian coastline is a magnet for marine assassins of all shapes and sizes. Though they vary in appearance and tactics, these vicious predators share one common trait: they are all exceptional killers.

programme.title: Big Cat Country
programme.desc: Meet the MK pride, led by two mighty males called the Punks, who are growing old. See younger members test their mettle as they face off with the all-male Nomad pride and the all-female Hollywood pride to defend the territory they've held for years.

programme.title: Big Cat Country
programme.desc: Check on the Hollywood matriarch, Ava, who is brutally wounded. Can the pride recover and rally around her? Meanwhile, observe the stealthy, dangerous tactics the MK and Nomad prides employ to protect their precious cubs and outsmart each other.

programme.title: Big Cat Country
programme.desc: Feel the tension ratchet up as the heat rises. Trail the Nomads on a rampage into the heart of the MK pride's territory as they vie for control. Then see the recovered Ava lead the Hollywood pride, who manage to steal a prized meal from a competitor.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: In Zambia's Luangwa Valley some of the largest animals on earth live side by side. Discover how each of these giants uses ingenious strategies and amazing adaptations, honed over millions of years, to survive-and thrive.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Liuwa Plains is a remote grassland and one of Africa's last wild places. Only the toughest of Africa's wildlife can survive here. Witness an extraordinary story of perseverance, adaptation, and survival in this extreme habitat.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Join the rescue team for a madcap chase after a red-tailed hawk. He may be unable to fly, but he sure can run! Then follow the recovery of a rare albino squirrel who can't walk, and see how the medical team ensures he'll be ready for the wild again.

programme.title: City Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Check in with the centre's resident turkey vulture, who's ready for release and in search of a flock. While Nathalie and her team rush to secure funding for a new facility, the medical team is baffled by a toad who has mysteriously taken ill.

programme.title: Great Lakes Wild
programme.desc: Since the 1900's, this uninhabited island in Lake Superior has been a constant battleground between moose and wolves. Join a band of volunteers as they scour the island for moose bones, trying to piece together population numbers after a long winter.

programme.title: Waterworld Africa
programme.desc: Follow a day in the life of the residents of a southern African mangrove forest, meeting red-claw mangrove crabs that manage the forest, vervet monkeys that occupy the canopy, and mudskippers and fiddler crabs that rule the mudflats.

programme.title: Rooted
programme.desc: Learn the story of the tree with the 'Hollow Heart'. Baobabs have been around for eight hundred years and survive extreme drought by storing water in their trunks, which elephants break off to eat in drier seasons. Luckily, this tree can heal itself.

programme.title: One Giant Leap
programme.desc: One mission in the darkness captured our imagination and brought us to our feet giving us the hope we needed to carry on.

programme.title: How The Universe Works (S8)
programme.desc: We thought we understood planet formation, but we were wrong. New discoveries of planets beyond our solar system force us to tear up the rule book on how planets form.

programme.title: Through The Wormhole With Morgan Freeman (S4)
programme.desc: We can trace our lives back to a beginning. But what defines the beginning? Is it the moment when two cells unite?
